attributes.name: DS.JSONAPISerializer

params.name: resourceHash
params.description: the resource hash from the adapter

methods.name: keyForAttribute
keyForRelationship
modelNameFromPayloadType
payloadTypeFromModelName

methods.description:
Given a subclass of `DS.Model` and a JSON object this method will
iterate through each attribute of the `DS.Model` and invoke the
`DS.Transform#deserialize` method on the matching property of the
JSON object.  This method is typically called after the
serializer's `normalize` method.
methods.name: applyTransforms
normalizeResponse
normalize

methods.description: Returns the resource's ID.
methods.name: extractId

methods.description:
Returns the resource's attributes formatted as a JSON-API "attributes object".

http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-object-attributes
methods.name: extractAttributes

methods.description:
Returns a relationship formatted as a JSON-API "relationship object".

http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-object-relationships
methods.name: extractRelationship

methods.description:
Returns a polymorphic relationship formatted as a JSON-API "relationship object".

http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-object-relationships

`relationshipOptions` is a hash which contains more information about the
polymorphic relationship which should be extracted:
  - `resourceHash` complete hash of the resource the relationship should be
    extracted from
  - `relationshipKey` key under which the value for the relationship is
    extracted from the resourceHash
  - `relationshipMeta` meta information about the relationship
methods.name: extractPolymorphicRelationship

methods.description:
Returns the resource's relationships formatted as a JSON-API "relationships object".

http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-resource-object-relationships
methods.name: extractRelationships

methods.description:
Looks up the property key that was set by the custom `attr` mapping
passed to the serializer.
methods.name: _getMappedKey

methods.description:
Check attrs.key.serialize property to inform if the `key`
can be serialized
methods.name: _canSerialize

return.description: true if the key can be serialized

methods.description:
When attrs.key.serialize is set to true then
it takes priority over the other checks and the related
attribute/relationship will be serialized
methods.name: _mustSerialize

return.description: true if the key must be serialized

methods.description: Check if the given hasMany relationship should be serialized
methods.name: shouldSerializeHasMany

return.description: true if the hasMany relationship should be serialized

methods.description: Check if the given hasMany relationship should be serialized
methods.name: _shouldSerializeHasMany

return.description: true if the hasMany relationship should be serialized

methods.name: serialize
serializeIntoHash
serializeAttribute
serializeBelongsTo
serializeHasMany
serializePolymorphicType
extractMeta
extractErrors
keyForAttribute
keyForRelationship

methods.description:
`keyForLink` can be used to define a custom key when deserializing link
properties.
methods.name: keyForLink

methods.description:
The `normalizeResponse` method is used to normalize a payload from the
server to a JSON-API Document.

http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-structure
methods.name: normalizeResponse

methods.description:
The `serialize` method is used when a record is saved in order to convert
the record into the form that your external data source expects.

`serialize` takes an optional `options` hash with a single option:

- `includeId`: If this is `true`, `serialize` should include the ID
  in the serialized object it builds.
methods.name: serialize

methods.description:
The `normalize` method is used to convert a payload received from your
external data source into the normalized form `store.push()` expects. You
should override this method, munge the hash and return the normalized
payload.
methods.name: normalize

properties.name: primaryKey
attrs

properties.description:
The `store` property is the application's `store` that contains all records.
It's injected as a service.
It can be used to push records from a non flat data structure server
response.
properties.name: store
